items.title: Grab partners with autonomous tech firms for AV expansion
items.summary:
- Grab signed MoUs with Autonomous A2Z, Motional, WeRide, and Zelos to explore AV integration in Southeast Asia.
- Pilot studies will assess AV technologies for shuttles, cars, delivery bots, and buses.
- Objectives include improving safety, reducing accidents, and enhancing traffic management.
- Collaboration with governments and driver associations will support safe AV rollout and infrastructure development.

items.title: SenseTime boosts AI cloud with DeepSeek integration
items.summary:
- SenseTime integrates DeepSeek Enterprise module into SenseCore, its AI cloud platform.
- The integration focuses on enhancing performance, stability, and efficiency for businesses and developers.
- Launched LazyLLM, an open-source framework to simplify AI application development.

items.title: Global investors bet on SEA stocks amid US-China tensions
items.summary:
- Southeast Asian startups face a funding winter but Singapore and Malaysia stocks are thriving amidst US-China tensions.
- Investors are shifting supply chains to Southeast Asia, leveraging the region's cost-effective resources, as noted by Paul Chew from Phillip Securities Research.
- Craig Loveless from Norton Rose Fulbright highlights Southeast Asia’s potential as a long-term growth area due to its demographics.
- As of January 31, the MSCI ASEAN Index reports a 16% return, compared to the S&P 500’s nearly 22% increase.
- Singapore and Malaysia have demonstrated strong market performances, with the Straits Times Index reaching record highs in February, supported by sector gains and currency stability.
- Opportunities are emerging in Malaysia due to significant reforms and investments, according to Tan Altundag of Pictet Asset Management.

items.title: Aramco’s investment arm leads $30m series A
items.summary:
- Aramco Ventures led a US$30 million Series A funding round for climate tech company Spiritus.
- Funding will help Spiritus scale its direct air capture (DAC) technology to reduce carbon emissions.
- Spiritus CEO Charles Cadieu emphasizes the need to tackle carbon emissions while expanding infrastructure.
- Bruce Niven from Aramco notes high costs of DAC hinder widespread adoption and highlights the importance of innovative technologies like Spiritus's for decarbonization.

items.title: OJK reviews J Trust Bank’s report on fintech startup Crowde
items.summary:
- The Financial Services Authority of Indonesia (OJK) is monitoring a conflict between PT JTrust Indonesia Tbk (J Trust Bank) and fintech firm Crowde over alleged fund embezzlement.
- J Trust Bank filed a police report with the Jakarta Police Department on February 11.
- OJK announced on March 7 that it is conducting audits to address fraud risks in the fintech lending sector.
- Discussions and joint visits to borrowers are ongoing between J Trust Bank and Crowde to resolve the issue.
- J Trust Bank partnered with Crowde as a peer-to-peer lending platform to finance farmers, but internal investigations revealed breaches in their Cooperation Agreement (PKS) regarding loan disbursements.

items.title: UAE-based healthtech firm Klaim raises $26m for AI payments
items.summary:
- Klaim raised $10 million in Series A funding and an additional $16 million for expansion.
- The funds will support operations in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Oman, and improve claims processing technology.
- Founded in 2019 in Abu Dhabi, Klaim uses AI and data analytics in healthcare payment solutions.

items.title: AI-powered ad startup Creatopy appoints new CEO
items.author: Tammy Nam
items.summary:
- Creatopy, an AI-driven digital advertising platform, has appointed Tammy Nam as its new CEO.
- Nam has previously held leadership positions at PicsArt and Viki, and will also join Creatopy’s board of directors.
- The former CEO, Dan Oros, will move to an advisory role.
- The company, founded in Romania, chose Nam for her background in scaling startups and expertise in marketing technology.

items.title: A letter to my younger self: Find what sets your soul on fire
items.summary:
[The article discusses self-discovery and personal growth.]
[It emphasizes finding one's passion and what truly motivates them.]
[Stories and reflections on the challenges and rewards of pursuing one's dreams are shared.]

items.title: TSMC plans to hire 8,000 in 2025
items.summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) plans to hire 8,000 employees in 2025 to expand production capacity.
- The company will visit 20 universities in Taiwan, starting with National Taiwan University, and conduct five online job events to attract talent globally.
- New engineers with master’s degrees can expect an average annual salary of NT$2.2 million (approximately US$66,875), which is well above Taiwan's average income in 2023.
- TSMC is seeking professionals in various fields including engineering, telecommunication, chemical engineering, finance, business management, and law for roles in multiple cities.
- The company has opened applications for its summer internship program, targeting master’s and PhD students, with top interns receiving potential full-time job offers.

items.title: Chocolate Finance suspends instant withdrawals due to ‘high demand’
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Chocolate Finance has temporarily suspended instant withdrawals due to high demand.
- Withdrawal requests will take 3 to 10 days to process, and once confirmed, cannot be cancelled.
- The company, founded in July, manages close to S$1 billion (US$750.8 million) in assets as of February.
- Founder Walter de Oude is also known for starting Singlife in 2014.
- Chocolate Finance specializes in investment opportunities for better returns and is licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

items.title: Australian AI startup Flowing Bee raises $1.6m for US expansion
items.author: Michael Sankey, Sara Khorasani
items.summary:
- Flowing Bee, a Melbourne-based startup, raised US$1.6 million for its AI-powered customer analysis platform.
- The funding aims to expand operations in the US, with plans to establish a presence in Silicon Valley.
- Founded by behavioral scientist Michael Sankey and technologist Sara Khorasani, the platform analyzes customer sentiment via AI and surveys to improve marketing efforts.
- Funds will also support platform refinement, emphasizing human oversight for data reliability.

items.title: Swiss private equity firm acquires Australian data centre
items.summary:
- Partners Group acquired GreenSquare DC for US$1.2 billion.
- The acquisition underscores growing international investment in data centres.
- Demand for cloud computing and AI infrastructure drives industry expansion.
- GreenSquare DC was founded in 2020 by Walt Coulston, who owned the company before the sale.
- The company operates a data centre in Sydney and additional sites in Melbourne and Perth.
- Partners Group has invested over US$4 billion in data centres since 2021.
- Industry growth is supported by tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.
- Specifics on GreenSquare's clients and acquisition terms are undisclosed.

items.title: Australian AI medical scribe Heidi Health bags $16.6m in funding
items.summary:
- Heidi Health raised US$16.6 million in a Series A follow-on funding round.
- Investment led by US venture capital firm Headline, with participation from Local Globe and existing investors like Blackbird and HESTA.
- Announcement made during presentation at the HIMSS conference in Las Vegas, which attracts healthcare industry stakeholders.
- Founded in 2019, Heidi Health develops AI tools for transcribing and summarizing patient consultations.
- The software processes over one million healthcare consultations weekly without recording audio.

items.title: China’s Amiao Robotics secures $14m from Anker
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Amiao Robotics raised approximately $14 million (100 million yuan) in a funding round led by Anker Innovations.
- Other investors included Zhipu Z Fund and K2 VC.
- The funding will assist Amiao in developing intelligent solutions for industrial and commercial applications.
- Amiao’s founder, Liu Fang, has prior experience at Google China and Xiaomi.
- Anker aims to support Amiao in improving automation and expanding robotics use in B2B applications.

items.title: Google removes DEI terms from AI ethics webpage
items.summary:
- Google updated its Responsible AI and Human Centered Technology (RAI-HCT) webpage, removing terms such as "diversity," "equity," and "marginalized communities."
- The webpage now uses broader terms instead of focusing on underrepresented groups.
- These changes were first reported by The Midas Project; Google has not responded to inquiries.
- This update follows Google's decision in February to review DEI programs and cancel diversity hiring targets.
- Other tech companies are also scaling back DEI initiatives amid scrutiny from the Trump administration.

items.title: US Justice Department still calls to break up Google
items.summary:
- The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is pushing to break up Google, suggesting the sale of Google Chrome and possibly Android.
- A revised court filing claims that selling Chrome would enhance competition in the internet search market.
- The DOJ's update removes the option for Google to sell Android unchanged and drops a halt on AI investments; however, Google must inform officials of future AI moves.
- Google proposed a plan without divestitures, instead suggesting limits on preinstalled apps.
- A hearing regarding these proposals is scheduled for April.

items.title: US in talks with 4 groups over TikTok sale, Trump says
items.summary:
- President Trump announced on Mar. 9 discussions with four parties regarding the sale of TikTok, owned by ByteDance.
- This follows a law enacted on Jan. 19 requiring ByteDance to divest TikTok on national security grounds or face a ban.
- Trump stated the options are viable but did not disclose buyer details, saying all four parties are good candidates.

items.title: Stablecoins rise as Hong Kong becomes regulation hub
items.summary:
- Stablecoins, linked to traditional currencies like the US dollar, now make up 20% of all crypto transactions.
- US dollar-backed stablecoins have a global market cap of around US$200 billion.
- Hong Kong is becoming a prominent market for stablecoin activities due to its US dollar peg and strong banking sector.
- Hong Kong plans to introduce regulations for stablecoins to enhance oversight amid rising global demand.

items.title: Chinese humanoid robotics startups raised $276m in early 2025
items.summary:
- China's humanoid robotics market raised US$276 million across 20 deals in early 2025.
- This is a significant increase from US$176 million raised in the same period last year.
- According to Morgan Stanley, 56% of the world’s humanoid robotics companies are based in China.
- China is set to begin mass production and commercialization of humanoid robots this year.
- Startups like LimX Dynamics, AI2Robotics, and Eyoubot secured funding, indicating rapid sector growth.

items.title: US regulator clears path for banks’ crypto activities
items.summary:
- US regulators have cleared the way for banks to engage in cryptocurrency activities.
- The decision aims to provide clearer guidelines and support for financial institutions exploring crypto.
- This regulatory move is expected to enhance the adoption of digital currencies and improve market stability.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- The article discusses how anonymous founders review venture capitalists (VCs).
- It highlights various perceptions and experiences of founders regarding VCs.
- Founders provide insights into the traits they value in VCs based on their interactions.

items.title: Apple delays Siri AI personalization updates to 2026
items.summary:
- Apple has delayed AI features for Siri to 2026, originally scheduled for 2025.
- The updates aim to enhance Siri’s personalization and contextual awareness.
- Siri will gain access to personal data to offer tailored recommendations.
- Apple cited a longer-than-expected development process for the delay.
- Siri processes 1.5 billion requests daily, competing with Google’s Assistant and Amazon’s Alexa.

items.title: China to implement AI courses in schools
items.summary:
- Beijing will introduce AI courses for primary and secondary students starting **Sept. 1, 2025**.
- Schools are required to provide at least **eight hours** of AI education each year.
- AI education can be standalone or integrated into subjects like **information technology** and **science**.
- The initiative aims to strengthen China's role in the **global AI sector**.
- The government's support for large-scale AI model development was reaffirmed at the **National People’s Congress**.
- Huai Jinpeng, the education minister, highlighted AI’s role in driving innovation in education.
- A **white paper** on AI in education is expected later this year.

items.title: Digital therapy firm Hinge Health plans IPO in April
items.summary:
- Hinge Health, a digital physical therapy company, is preparing to file for an IPO soon with a target listing by April.
- Founded in 2014, the startup specializes in virtual musculoskeletal therapy and pain management devices.
- The company reported $390 million in revenue for 2024, $45 million in free cash flow, and has gross margins of about 78%.
- Valued at $6.2 billion in 2021, Hinge Health has raised over $1 billion in funding from investors like Tiger Global and Coatue Management.
- The physical therapy market is expected to grow to $70 billion by the end of the decade, with Hinge Health being four times larger than its closest competitor, Sword Health.
- Advancements in AI have contributed to the expansion and scalability of Hinge Health's care team.

items.title: Israeli college names AI expert to lead new tech faculty
items.author: Dr. Gail Gilboa Freedman
items.summary:
- Sapir Academic College in Israel has appointed Dr. Gail Gilboa Freedman to lead the new Faculty of Advanced Technologies.
- The faculty aims to equip students with skills for advancements in AI and robotics.
- Dr. Gilboa Freedman emphasizes that AI is reshaping the job landscape, not just replacing jobs.
- Collaboration with industry leaders is part of the faculty's strategy to prepare students for a changing job market.
- Hands-on experience is stressed as crucial due to the short lifespan of technological skills.
- The program aims to bridge gaps between smaller institutions and top universities, driving economic transformation in the Western Negev region.
- Efforts align with the initiative to prepare society for a future where humans and AI collaborate, creating new industries and roles.

items.title: 100 and counting: India’s growing unicorn roster
items.summary:
- India added 70 unicorns from 2021 to 2024, reaching a total of 105.
- 2021 and 2022 saw nearly 60% of unicorns achieved their valuation during a funding boom.
- The total capital raised by Indian startups in 2024 dropped to around US$17 billion, a threefold decrease from 2020.
- Byju's, once the most valuable startup, is facing insolvency in 2024.
- Nine new unicorns emerged in India since 2024, with notable inclusions in fintech, logistics, and biotech.
- Major investors include Peak XV, Tiger Global, Accel Partners, and Elevation Capital.
- Four startups with billion-dollar valuations went public in 2024, contrasting with Southeast Asia, where no unicorns have gone public since late 2022.

items.title: Surviving the funding game: how timing can make or break your startup
items.summary:
- Raising funds is critical for startups and varies significantly between funding stages.
- Industries like healthcare experience longer gaps between funding due to product development and regulatory approvals.
- Economic conditions influence investor sentiment and timing in raising funds.
- Delays in funding can jeopardize a startup’s operations, leading to layoffs or bankruptcy.
- Faster funding enables growth, hiring, and product development, enhancing survival chances.

items.title: 2024 went swimmingly for Sea Group
items.author: Miguel Cordon
items.summary:
• Revenue from SeaMoney grew 35% year on year in 2024, making it Sea Group’s second-largest arm by revenue.
• SeaMoney's revenue doubled compared to 2022, reflecting rapid growth.
• Garena remains the most profitable unit for Sea Group, with increased bookings and earnings in 2024.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Israel
Crypto exchange Kraken plans 2026 IPO
items.summary:
- Kraken plans to go public in Q1 2026 as US regulatory conditions improve.
- The SEC recently dropped its case against Kraken without charges.
- Kraken reported 2024 revenue exceeding $1.5 billion with adjusted earnings of $380 million.
- Ranked 10th largest crypto exchange by trading volume, joining others exploring IPOs as the market recovers.
- Founded in 2011, Kraken has raised about $27 million in primary funding.

items.title: Nazara sells major gaming stake for $11.9m deal
items.summary:
- Nazara Technologies sells 94.85% stake in OpenPlay Technologies to Moonshine Technology for approximately $11.97 million.
- Deal involves issuing 199,890 compulsory convertible preference shares at $0.11 each.
- Moonshine acquires OpenPlay’s rummy platform, enhancing its real money gaming portfolio.
- OpenPlay’s ClassicRummy will also become a subsidiary of Moonshine.
- Nazara's board also approved a $250,000 investment in ReelSaga Innovations for a 3.57% equity stake.

items.title: Dubai delivery app acquires marketplace instashop for $32m
items.summary:
- Kuwait-based delivery platform talabat has acquired 100% of instashop from Delivery Hero SE for US$32 million, finalizing the deal in March 2025.
- Instashop will remain a standalone brand within talabat’s grocery and retail division.
- Founded in 2015 in the UAE, instashop operates in the UAE, Bahrain, Egypt, Lebanon, and Qatar.
- Instashop reported an annual gross merchandise volume of US$631 million in 2024, a 16% increase from the previous year.
- This acquisition strengthens talabat’s grocery and retail offerings in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region.
- Instashop’s operations will integrate with talabat’s structure while maintaining brand independence.

items.title: Trump softens stance on Taiwan after TSMC’s $100b investment
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump softened his stance on Taiwan's semiconductor industry following TSMC's announcement of a US$100 billion investment in the US.
- He acknowledged Taiwan's leadership in the sector, attributing it to past US policies while criticizing previous tariffs on Taiwanese imports.
- TSMC plans to build five advanced chip plants in Arizona, expected to strengthen the US semiconductor industry and reflect shifts in global supply chains.

items.title: Taiwan-based Meta cloud supplier boosts 2025 investment to $548m
items.summary:
- Wiwynn Corp increases its 2025 capital expenditure to NT$18 billion (US$548 million) amid higher US tariffs on Mexican imports.
- The budget supports a US$300 million factory in Texas, a new facility in Kaohsiung, and expansions in Mexico and Malaysia.
- CFO Harry Chen states Texas facility provides flexibility for clients affected by tariffs, without replacing operations in Mexico.
- Some clients have moved production to Wiwynn’s plants in the Czech Republic or Malaysia.
- In February 2025, Wiwynn reported NT$46.51 billion in revenue, a 91.22% year-over-year increase, with total revenue for the first two months at NT$84.02 billion.
- Wiwynn anticipates growing demand for AI and general-purpose servers due to investments from cloud giants like Meta and Microsoft.
- The company plans to start shipping AI servers powered by Nvidia chips later this quarter.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.author: Terence Lee, Yeo Cheng Yong
items.summary:
- The article explores recent funding trends and investors in Southeast Asia.
- It is divided into two main sections: **weekly update** for recent data and **macro trends** for an overarching view of funding across various sectors.
- Notable investors and companies in the region are highlighted, emphasizing the shifts in investment patterns.

items.title: Indian state offers $799m incentives to Foxconn
items.summary:
- Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced incentives worth ₹6,970 crore (US$799.4 million) for Foxconn on March 7, 2025.
- The incentives will facilitate the establishment of a smartphone manufacturing plant in Devanahalli Industrial Area with a projected investment of ₹21,911 crore (US$2.51 billion).
- The facility will occupy 300 acres in Bengaluru Rural district and aims to create 500,000 jobs while supporting deeptech startups under the Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP).

items.title: Musk to face questioning over Twitter acquisition
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Elon Musk will be questioned regarding his acquisition of Twitter.
- The questioning is part of ongoing investigations into the deal.
- This scrutiny reflects broader concerns around social media ownership and influence.

items.title: A16z-backed AI developer firm in talks for $10b valuation
items.summary:
- Anysphere Inc. seeks to raise several hundred million dollars in funding.
- The funding round could value the company at nearly US$10 billion, up from US$2.5 billion in January.
- Anysphere has achieved over US$100 million in annual recurring revenue within the last year and secured around US$175 million in venture capital, including investments from Andreessen Horowitz.
- The funding would indicate robust investor interest in AI-powered tools like coding assistants and chatbots.
- No comments from Thrive Capital or Anysphere regarding the negotiations.

items.title: Tesla stock hits 7-week slump, loses over $800b value
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock has declined for seven consecutive weeks, reaching a closing price of US$270.48 on Mar. 7, the lowest since Nov. 5.
- The market capitalization has fallen by over US$800 billion since peaking at nearly US$480 on Dec. 17.
- Wall Street firms like Bank of America and Goldman Sachs lowered their price targets due to weaker sales and competition in China.
- Production issues related to the Model Y transition are contributing to the slump.
- Concerns regarding Elon Musk’s political engagements and public remarks have negatively affected sentiment.
- Despite challenges, some analysts remain optimistic; Wedbush Securities maintains a US$550 price target for Tesla.

items.title: DeepSeek’s rise sparks AI market shake-up
items.summary:
- DeepSeek launched its app on Jan. 20, 2025, offering a low-cost large language model for free.
- It became the most downloaded freeware app on the US iOS App Store within two days, surpassing OpenAI’s ChatGPT.
- The launch coincided with the World Economic Forum in Davos, attracting global investor interest.
- CEO Bonnie Chan Yiting noted it led to a reassessment of Chinese tech stocks and improved investor confidence.
- Nvidia’s stocks dropped 17% on Jan. 27, losing US$600 billion in value as investors reconsidered tech valuations against DeepSeek's model.
- The decline continued with an additional 4% drop, indicating a shift in market dynamics favoring Chinese AI firms.

items.title: Microsoft develops new AI models to compete with OpenAI
items.summary:
- Microsoft has developed proprietary AI models called "MAI" to compete with OpenAI and Anthropic.
- These models are being evaluated for use in Microsoft’s Copilot AI assistants.
- The company is also working on "reasoning models" to handle complex queries, an area also pursued by competitors.
- Microsoft aims to reduce its reliance on OpenAI while renegotiating their $13 billion partnership, allowing OpenAI to use other cloud providers until 2030.
- The company tests a mix of AI models, including in-house designs and options from Meta, Anthropic, and xAI.
- Microsoft’s investment in AI infrastructure includes smaller models dubbed "Phi" and aims to diversify its offerings.

items.title: US justice department drops Google AI divestment bid
items.summary:
• The US Department of Justice has withdrawn its proposal for Google to divest its AI investments, including its stake in Anthropic.
• The DOJ and 38 state attorneys general continue to pursue other measures in their antitrust case, including forcing Google to divest its Chrome browser.
• New evidence revealed potential risks of limiting Google's AI involvement; the DOJ now proposes Google report future investments in generative AI.
• Google argues that forced divestitures may weaken its AI position, benefiting rivals like OpenAI and Microsoft.
• The antitrust crackdown on Big Tech continues, with a trial set for April and other DOJ proposals still in play, such as sharing search query data with competitors.

items.title: LatAm fintech giant’s investor relation officer to step down
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Jörg Friedemann, investor relations officer at Nubank, will step down by April 2025.
- He joined Nubank in July 2022 and is leaving for another opportunity.
- Prior to Nubank, he led financial equity research for Latin America at Citigroup and held roles at Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, and UBS.
- Friedemann currently serves as Nubank’s global head of ESG and market intelligence.
- No official statements have been made by either Friedemann or Nubank regarding his departure.

items.title: US weighs DeepSeek ban on gov’t devices, sources say
items.summary:
- The US government is considering banning the Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek from government devices due to national security concerns.
- Officials are worried about DeepSeek's data handling as user information is stored on servers in China.
- 21 state attorneys general have urged Congress to prohibit DeepSeek on government devices.
- The White House has not yet commented on the issue.
- DeepSeek gained attention in January 2025 when its low-cost AI models affected global equity markets.

items.title: US Trade Office to Hold Hearing on Chinese Semiconductor
items.summary:
- The US Trade Representative’s Office (USTR) will hold a hearing on March 11 concerning Chinese-made legacy semiconductors.
- The hearing may result in increased tariffs on these chips used in various products, including automobiles and telecom equipment.
- An investigation was launched in December 2024, focusing on concerns regarding China's state-supported semiconductor industry.
- As of January 1, 2025, a 50% tariff on Chinese semiconductors is already in place.
- A report from the Commerce Department indicates that two-thirds of US semiconductor-using products include Chinese legacy chips, with many companies unaware of their origins.
- The investigation is conducted under Section 301 of the Trade Act of 1974, previously used for tariffs on $370 billion in Chinese goods.
- Stakeholders include the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers and the Foundation for American Innovation, each presenting opposing views on subsidies.
- The hearing's results could impact US-China trade policy and the global semiconductor market.

items.title: Shift happens!
items.summary:
- Darwinbox secured US$140 million in a series E funding round co-led by Partners Group and KKR.
- Flow48 raised US$69 million in series A funding led by Breega.
- NXin received US$39.8 million in strategic funding.
- Grain locked in US$33 million in series A funding led by Bain Capital Ventures.
- Heidi Health raised US$16.6 million in series A funding.
- Digiledge was acquired by Mintoak; amount undisclosed.
- IFreedom was acquired by Boss Wallah; amount undisclosed.
- Freshreview was acquired by GaragePlug; amount undisclosed.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Korea
items.summary:
- A list of the 50 Korean startups and tech companies that have raised the most money from investors.
- The funding data used is from the past two years to keep the list current.
- For additional data and research methodology, readers can access Tech in Asia's database on tech companies in Asia.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Korea
BBC launches AI unit to personalize news
items.summary:
- The BBC is establishing a new department, BBC News Growth, Innovation, and AI, to use AI for personalized news content.
- This initiative is part of a broader restructuring led by BBC News CEO Deborah Turness aimed at engaging younger audiences under 25 as news moves to digital platforms.
- The new unit will focus on AI applications like story curation based on user habits and aims to enhance news delivery, addressing challenges such as news avoidance and declining broadcast viewership.
- A new BBC Live and Daily News unit will also be launched to improve content distribution.
- A director will be appointed to oversee AI investments and audience engagement.

items.title: Ex-TSMC chairman Mark Liu joins Micron to boost AI efforts
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Mark Liu, former chairman of TSMC, has joined Micron Technology's board of directors for AI development.
- Micron’s CEO Sanjay Mehrotra highlighted Liu’s semiconductor experience as vital for AI in data centers and edge computing.
- Liu has over 30 years of experience at TSMC, significantly contributing to its growth and advanced fabrication facilities.
